source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Bulbils absent; lamina ovate-triangular; pinnules with finely pointed teeth; stipe-base scales papery, dull, light to mid-brown and uniform in colour; some rachis scales usually small with hair-like projections; East Gippsland only

Small plantlets (bulbils) usually budding from near apex of main rachis; lamina lanceolate-oblong to narrowly ovate; pinnules broadly serrate; stipe-base scales glossy, dark brown with paler borders; rachis scales all long and silky; widespread
